reviews.review: Best half life in the series. It took all the good things about Half Life and put them into one game. I highly recommend it to anyone!!

It's a really great game. A fun classic 9.5/10

I think this is the hardest game in the franchise. It feels more action-packed and fast-paced than the original game. It's very cool to see the events of the Black Mesa incident from a different perspective. And you get to use lots of new different weapons. Loved it!

Pros:
All the high tech AI soldier buddies really add a lot of depth and personality to the same old Half Life by having to escort them and click on them to sometimes make you follow them, same goes for the rope swinging donkey kong mechanics those weren't janky at all

Cons:
This game features too many new and fun weapons and aliens, they just kept interrupting all the AI buddy sections and it got incredibly annoying, the devs didn't have their priorities straight on this one. Like I think there are more new weapons than there are rope swings in the game, wtf.
Watch out for the Shockroaches when you kill Shocktroopers

A lot shorter than the main game, but just as enjoyable. Your role on the opposite side mixed with unique enemies make for a good 3 hour play through (assuming you finished the main campaign and are a decent shot). If you for some reason want more classic half life after the 20+ years of this extension existing, get it I guess. I mean everyone reading these already owns the game or are in my friends list and if you're actually meaning to find a review to guide your purchase there's a lot better options elsewhere... good game.
Another fantastic Half Life  game.I recommend this game to all ..

Great expansion, one of the best expansions of all time. HL:OF is an expasion that delivers and expands the original game for the best while keeping what made it an amazing game, every addition that Gearbox is really nice to mix the gameplay and not keep the player.
 The story puts you in the shoes of the bad guys that you fought in the base game, the Marine Corps Forces with you being Corporal Shepard that is sent to Black Mesa Facility. But unfortunately you crash with no orders to follow so you try to escape while helping along the way not only the Marines but also the Scientists and Security Guards instead of slaughtering them.
 During the campaing, you encounter new enemies with them being a new race of aliens and the male assassins with you also being provided along the way news awesome weapons, abilities and marines sometimes that you can use.
 Game also has some good fan service with the player having sometimes deja vus of areas that were already seen and visited on the base game. Also in the game you can encounter Doctor Freeman himself and if you try to follow him, you will die with cause being that the player tried to create a paradox, something that I thought was really a unique touch.
 Overall I recommend this expansion, in your 1st playthrough you will finish in like 5-6 hours and in the meanwhile it will be your best hours, this expansion does everything right with the expansion keeping what made the original HL so good while giving new things to explore, use and kill. Overall a 10/10 for me.
Better in every way than the original half life, if you enjoyed that, there's no reason not to play this.

Just a few more hours of good, old Half Life we all know and love. Nice thing is you can see some places around Black Mesa facility from a different perspective.
So it's a mix of visiting the places you already recognize from a basic Half Life with exploring more, new areas around the complex.
Things happen around the human world, which is also a positive for me - no visiting alien floating rocks in space.
Also no more tank aliens shooting worms at you!

Hands down, best game I ever played. In this DLC- I mean ExPaNsIon PaCk, you walk around the Black Mesa facility in the eyes of Adrian Shepard, you can see multiple events you saw in the original Half-Life but in Shepard's shoes. So far, this is the best Expansion Pack I ever played. It's sad how this game is so short, its very unique than the other Half-Life games, if this was longer, I would give this a better rating.  To summarize, I'll give this Expansion Pack a 8/10.

A perfect addition to the Half Life universe. Fixes a lot of the pacing issues found in the original game as well as offering a fresh new experience from the eyes of a different protagonist. Still a shame Valve hasn't done anything with Adrian Sheppard :/
